case.name: IO Group Inc v Prestige Club Australasia Pty Ltd (No 2) [2008] FCA 1237 (11 August 2008)

citphrases.citphrase: whether draft expert report, letters of instruction from clients' solicitors to expert witness, and notes prepared for preparation of final report are privileged
whether privilege waived by service of final expert report
whether draft reports, letters of instruction and notes influenced content of final report so that use or service of final report inconsistent with maintaining privilege in those materials
waiver of privilege by voluntary disclosure

held: draft expert report and preliminary letters of instruction from clients' solicitors to expert witness, privileged because created for dominant purpose of plaintiff being provided with legal services
exclusion of evidence of settlement negotiations
communication of extract of document made in the course of settlement negotiations
held that defendant not entitled to inspect balance of document. considered: evidence act 1995 (cth), ss 117 , 119 , 122 , 126 , 131 (1)procedure
documents created during later period reflecting historical financial position of company
where process of giving discovery of certain class of documents would be onerous
utility of discovery outweighed by burden

principles applicable to consideration of claim of legal professional privilege discussed. the applicant objected to the production of certain documents listed in its affidavit of discovery on the ground of legal professional privilege. on the respondent's application for inspection,
report to department of public health on injury received by inmate of psychiatric centre
report obtained inter alia with intention of forwarding it to legal adviser if proceedings instituted against commission for damages for default.
